intro: Gerbera pulvinata, commonly known as the African gerbera, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white, pink, or red ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gerbera pulvinata is well-suited for gardens and containers, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil.
